name: Hostal L' Antic Espai

reviews.title: my reservations experience with Hostal L'Antic Espai
reviews.text: In all fairness to the Hostal L'Antic Espai, I feel the need to respond because of the review by mer772 from Montreal.

I booked a room for May 2008 via email. I was incredibly surprised how Sergio or Abel responded so quickly! I had several questions and emailed several times. Each response was detailed, VERY friendly and courteous. After booking via email, I had called the hotel directly (from Brooklyn, NY!) a week later to ask some more questions. Whomever I spoke to was eager to answer my questions and even confirmed my booking (without me asking).
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful antiques, but noise, noise, noise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know when calling overseas, you need to take the time difference into account. If no one answers, it's probably because they are busy taking care of their guests. Based on the tripadvisor reviews, I booked this hotel because of the service that the staff gives, along with the location of the property.
reviews.title: disappointing potential stay at l'antic espai

likes.liked: — THE SERVICE AND BOOKING A RESERVATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The experience I had with this hotel so far has been nothing more than pleasant, friendly, & professional
reviews.title: So glad we found it

reviews.text: This hotel is an easy walk from Playa de Catalunya and the Passeig de Gracia (a three-line Metro transfer station), so great, convenient location. The staff was helpful and the decor beautiful. But we had a (very small) room off the terrace and it was the noisiest room we've ever been in! There is a day care playground just over the terrace wall, so little children played loudly all day and well into the evening. (Not too big a problem, since we weren't there much during the day, but contstant when we were.) The rooms that face the terrace have only the glass terrace doors for a noise barrier. We had very loud neighbors who partied in their room until 1 AM, then went out and returned noisily at 4 AM. (Asked the person on staff if she could ask them to quiet down at a little after midnight, but it didn't help.) There are also flats not owned by the hotel that face the terrace on higher levels and there was a huge party in one of those rooms the next night until well after 3 AM! Earplugs barely made a dent. Maybe just our bad luck, but we'd definitely choose another place next time.
reviews.title: Trip Advisor Expectations Were too High

likes.disliked: — seconld floor location, cramped lobby, no windows in common areas

reviews.text: The wonder of trip advisor - no - not this hotel - but that both the previous reviews can be correct - which they are !!!
reviews.title: the wonder of trip advisor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is a gem , very different & very quirky but yes if 3 stay in a triple room it will be very very cramped.See previous reviews ref antiques,ornaments etc - they must spend hours dusting everything !!
reviews.title: We agree totally!

reviews.text: i was travelling with my mate & the doubles looked like doubles not twins , the triple was only about 15 euros more so we booked that & for 2 it was fine, for 3 with cases horrible like camping.
reviews.title: a little gem

reviews.text: the location is good, if u want something out of the ordinary but without spending a fortune give it a go
reviews.title: Didn't love the L'Antic Espai

likes.disliked: — The tiny rooms, service, the price

reviews.title: A very Special Place
reviews.text: It's hard to add anything more to the previous reviews, other than we agree with the positive comments. We took the bus from the airport to Plaza Catalunya. Facing the Corte Ingles store, go left 2 1/2 blocks to the Gran Via, and then go right two blocks. It's easy to get to. For a different hotel experience, this is fantastic. We felt as though we were guests of a well-to-do family from around the turn-of-the-century who owned one of those five-story houses along the Gran Via. We had probably the best room (and the most expensive at 135 euro), #102, because it includes the balcony that projects out over the front entrance. The ceiling has the original stucco and gold-leaf trim with a glass chandelier. The warmth and attentiveness of Sergio and Abel add a lot to one's stay. The hotel is a marvelous showplace for the beautiful art pieces that they collect. This is a peaceful, safe, romantic place to stay in a busy city.

We were absolutely thrilled with our stay at Hostal L'Antic espai! The accommodations were very comfortable and the staff was terrific. The bathrooms were new and very nice. Once, when I was trying to buy tickets to a concert, one of the staff ran across the street to find me at a kiosk to help me decipher the Catalonian. They were extremely helpful and courteous. The collection of antiques was amazing. And the location was great. I would go back and stay there in a second!
reviews.title: Adored the Hostel L'Antic espai

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hostal is ideally situated. The decor of the hostal is charming. We were made to feel very welcome and were given good information of places and restaurants to visit.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — the location and decor and friendliness of owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We look forward to returning to Barcelona soon. We would definately stay at Hostal L'Antic Espai again. We can recommend Room104 which has the use of a large terrace.
reviews.title: Unique experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were visiting Barcelona to celebrate our 30th wedding anniversary and were looking for a hotel which would make the visit more memorable. After reading tripadvisor reviews we had no hesitation in booking 3 nights at the Antic Espai. Booking online was easy and reassuring as we discussed with Sergio the best room for our requirements (quiet).
reviews.title: Very Memorable Experience

reviews.text: The entrance from the road is unusual as there is an intercom system which allows access to the hotel on the first floor which was well advised in previous reviews. Any anxieties were immediately dispelled when entering the hotel which is beautifully decorated with antique furniture and porcelain.
reviews.title: Fabulous L'Antic Espai
Good location and lovely rooms
reviews.text: We only had one night sadly, but our room was lovely and the hotel was surprising easy to find. Even though we arrived at 11pm, we were offered a welcome drink, which sadly we had to decline as we were in a hurry to go out and have dinner. The location is good - about a 10 minute walk from the Born area and close to the Ramblas etc. Good shopping nearby if you like that sort of thing - including a large zara.

Only thing not so good was the lack of breakfast. Confusingly, there was a menu in our room mentioning a terrace and breakfast, but when we left the next morning and asked at reception (I think it was a maid on duty) she just said 'no breakfast'. So we found a hotel cafe nearby. Was a shame to leave on a bit of a downer like that so for that reason I'm not giving it 5 marks.
reviews.title: A truly unique Barcelona experience

likes.liked: — (1) excellent location with easy access to Barcelona attractions; and (2) beautiful antique-furnished apartment
likes.disliked: — Some people may not like having to press the street-side intercom to be let in and having to climb 2 stories of old marble stairs (we loved it).

reviews.text: This "hostal" (collection of rooms) is a hidden gem on the second floor of an apartment building centrally located near Placa de la Catalunya and Las Ramblas. If you want a clean, modern, boring hotel with a big lobby, a reception desk and an elevator, then this place is not for you. But if you think you might enjoy the chance to stay as an honored guest in one of 10 rooms in a beautiful antique apartment, it's a unique experience. The owners and staff are friendly, helpful and attentive to every need. The parlor and the individual rooms are beautiful, the bathrooms are brand new and the patio which adjoins several of the rooms is lovely. The rooms are surprisingly quiet and peaceful, considering that the apartment building is located on Gran Via de la Cortes Catalan, a major and very noisy avenue in the heart of the city. We stayed here with our three teenage daughters and everybody had a wonderful time. The owner/operators have lovingly renovated and furnished the apartment and it is a thing of beauty, even though the parlor has a very large flat panel TV and a computer for guests' use. All in all, a wonderful experience and a great way to stay in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Lovely L'Antic

reviews.text: A friend and I were travelling in Spain and France for 2 weeks, as we made our plans, we were having trouble finding affordable and attractive lodging. Centrally located places were either exorbitant or unavailable. Luckily my friend found the L'antic.
reviews.title: Excellent stay at L'Antic Espai!!!!

likes.liked: — The staff, the charming rooms, the terrace, the location

reviews.text: The hotel is in a great location, close to Las Ramblas and easy to walk everywhere. The building seems to be an apartment building and is next door to others (e.g., you can hear regular city life in apartments through the patio window), but that was fine with us. It added to the charm and it was nice not to be in some big box hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was quite large. We found the decor charming, and the room was very bright with an attached patio. We had two twin beds. The bathroom was smaller than small, but spotless, functional and cute. The hair dryer, however was a little nuts--it had the power of someone blowing out birthday candles with gusto.
reviews.title: Old World Charm

likes.liked: — It's charm and attention to detail.

reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights before a Med cruise. Is the place quirky? Yes. Would I recommend to a friend or stay again. Absolutely on both counts. We had room 104 which had terrace access and we loved it. The service provided by Segio, Abel (thank you for your help with voluminous luggage) and the lovely Carla were exemplary. I just wish we had booked earlier for our cruise return somthat we could have enjoyed even longer.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hostal L'Antic Espai for 11 days during June. There is not enough space on this posting to note all the positive things we can say about this establishment. The fantastic hosts/owners - Abel and Sergio - were ever attentive, knowledgeable, and courteous. They knew the local area well and gave many recommendations for restaurants and shopping venues - all to our liking. They helped with language and cultural issues.
reviews.title: Fantastic - highly recommended

reviews.text: This Boutique Hotel is comfortable, extremely well decorated with tasteful antiques, knick-knacks, and pieces of art. Both hosts are very knowledgeable about their antiques and furniture. Rooms are decorated in-line with certain time periods. Particularly appreciated was their laundry service, high speed internet access, the breakfasts, the beautiful maid Carla, the antiques, the authentic floor tiles, the security of the building (fingerprint technology), the frilly shower caps and overall value for money. The location is ideal - 3 mins to La Ramblas or the Cathedral. Taxi stand at the door stop. Metro train 2 mins.
reviews.title: My home in Barcelona!

reviews.text: Chain Hotels are a dime a dozen and meet a certain need within the travel market - but Hostal L'Antic Espai is unique. We have no hesitation in recommending this Boutique Hotel to visitors to Barcelona. I am confident that Abel and Sergio will ensure that your stay is as memorable as ours was.
reviews.title: Not onlhy will we be back but will recommend it to any of our family/friends going to Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If we could - we would be back there tomorrow.
reviews.title: 6/5 rating - if that was available!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other thing that was disappointing is that there is no english TV channels which was surprising and not something I could easily get used too.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

likes.liked: — The terrace, huge room and the beautiful decor.
likes.disliked: — The on street entrance, but this is a very small gripe.

reviews.title: my second home
reviews.text: Also on the website they state that they have laundry facilities but this is not really the case. They made us an offer to do one load of laundry (a full load only) for 20 Euros- we wanted to launder 2 pairs of jeans so of course I was not going to pay 20 Euros!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there with my teen daughter for 4 nights. Great location.. beautiful rooms... But, where were the wonderful, helpful, friendly staff that I read about?? I speak Spanish, so I don't think it was a language thing.
reviews.title: Expected more...

reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel, we were buzzed in and someone carried our bags up the flight of stairs, but the gentleman seemed surprised/annoyed that we were there, and didn't offer much in the way of a greeting (I thought that we were at the wrong place!) We were shown to our room and given water, but the gentleman seemed very uncomfortable with us, and quickly left. We were given no information about the neighborhood (e.g., where to eat, location of transportation...), and this odd attitude lasted throughout our stay!
reviews.title: AS GOOD AS THEY SAY!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rest of the stay was fine. Great room, great location... but we always felt uncomfortable with the staff. One morning the fire alarm went off at 6:30am, and continued to RING LOUDLY for 1 hour! No apology nor explanation was given.
reviews.title: Nice place at a fair price

reviews.text: Two nights here on 16th - 18th November out of Newcastle ... on recommendation from TripAdvisor reviews (of course...)
reviews.title: Bed made for Colonel Tom Thumb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Easy to find thanks to directions on this site
reviews.title: choice of rooms

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay. We travelled with another couple, our friend got sick and that s when we realized that we were almost at home. Abel and Sergio are excellents hosts, Abel is a Doctor and he has always making sure that our friend was doing fine. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, the location is suberb, and the price is extremely competitive. Deffinitely a gem in Barcelona. You will not find a flashy lobby or spacious rooms, but you will find many other things you won t find on the expensive options. In a balance, I deffinitely will go for this place.
reviews.title: Just Like Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from 2 weeks in spain, spending our last 2 nights in Barcelona at L'antic Espai. The location is spectacular...3 blocks from the Casa Balti, and 3 blocks from the airport bus stop. On the second floor of a gracious Barcelona townhouse, this hotel is a little gem. The special touches are wonderful; choclate truffles, terry bath robes, crystal water glasses, lovely furnishings, in house video library. Don't be put off by the rather rustic front door. Serge and company make you feel special from the first minute you arrive. I wish I could have stayed longer!
reviews.title: loved the antiques at L'Antic

reviews.text: After reading all the positive reviews, my friends and I decided to stay at the Hostal L'Antic Espai in Barcelona, Spain. There were a few outweighing factors that assisted in making our decision: 1) Recommendations - As I mentioned, the place had received countless positive reviews and the hotel did fit the bill, by exceeding our expectations. 2) Location - The Hotel is conveniently located a few blocks from plenty of shopping stores and is approximately a 10 walking distance from Las Ramblas. There is a Metro stop approximately two blocks away and many historical sites and museums are within walking distance. 3) Price - In comparing prices to neighboring hotels, the price per night (for a triple bed) totalled approximately 144 (USD) 14, whereas other hotels charged as much as 400+ per night. The staff namely Sergio, Felipe, and Abel were extremely helpful and on numerous occasions went out of their way to feel guests feel welcomed. I personally goofed on our reservations a few times, which caused them to make several changes to our reservations and during each correspondence they warmly made my changes. The rooms are fashionably decorated (much like the staff) and offer a warm welcome. The terrace is a good spot to enjoy the weather while reading a book. You will be able to hear children laughing and playing as the Hotel lies near a school, but they cannot be heard once the doors are shut.
reviews.title: Exceeded our Expectations!

reviews.text: We thoroughly agree with all the positive comments made by previous reviewers - this is a real gem of a small hotel, with wonderful owners and staff, in a fantastic location. They have managed to achieve a blend of old-fashioned charm and antiques with modern luxuries and technology. The beds had excellent quality mattresses, the room was spotlessly clean, it was surprisingly quiet at night, and we felt we could have asked for anything extra we needed. We thought it was a real bonus to come back after a long day's sightseeing and sit on the beautiful terrace with an evening cup of tea (for a very reasonable 2 euros for a really big pot of tea)! And our son appreciated the drawers of DVDs to choose from to watch in bed. On our first evening we were recommended the tapas restaurant Ciudad Condal, about 10 minutes' walk away, which was a great tip, and we returned there several times to eat early-mid evening, as we didn't want a late night dinner.
reviews.title: Very restful and friendly

reviews.text: I loved my 13 day stay at this charming hotel. I felt at home immediately.
reviews.title: Comfortable and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in Room 106, a single room, that opened on to the terrace where breakfast was served. I highly recommend a room opening onto the terrace because you can also enjoy the terrace in the evening after a long day of walking. The terrace has lovely plants and small birds in nice cages.
reviews.title: Lovely little hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was very comfortable. The bed was larger than an American single bed, just a little smaller than an American double bed. The room was very clean. The bathroom had a nice shower with good water pressure. There was a very good hair dryer.
reviews.title: Cozy, romantic boutique hotel with tremendous charm and super nice staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was ideal. It is only a few blocks from Plaza de Catalunya and two blocks from Passeig de Gracia. The hotel is within walking distance of most tourist sites and also near two metro stations. The AeroBus from the airport stops at Plaza de Catalunya and it is a five minute walk to the hotel. It could not be more ideally located and yet it is also very quiet.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: If you're looking for a well-priced delightful and charming Old World style B&B in the heart of Barcelona, this is your place! We arrived after a lengthy flight from the US to be greeted by Carla, the housekeeper, who promptly toted our heavy bags upstairs to the 2nd floor where this B&B is located. Hosts Sergio and Abel have gone to great lengths to create charm and comfort. Rooms are lovingly decorated with antiques, beds are comfy with a water carafe at bedside, bathrooms are modern, pristine and fully stocked (including a hairdryer ), there's even a free computer for guests in the reception area. Breakfast is ample and served on fine china. Sergio and Abel provided very useful tips for sightseeing and were even kind enough to book us tickets in advance so that we could skip the long lines at Sagrada Familia. We can't wait to return in 2012!
reviews.title: Soft Landing in Barcelona!

reviews.text: We just returned from a two-week stay in Spain. After a week playing golf at Costa del Sol we spent 5 days in Barcelona and stayed at this boutique hotel. Unfortunately we were not able to book one of the larger rooms so my husband and I stayed in one of the smaller twin rooms. The operative word here is "small." You have to book months in advance to get a room really big enough for two if you're staying more than a day or so. We were not able to unpack. However, we did see the bigger rooms and would would have no problem returning to a bigger room. The hotel consists of 10 rooms on one floor in a residential building and is quite charming; decorated with antiques. The rooms were clean, and the service terrific. The location is excellent, just two blocks away from Plaza Catalunya. This hotel is a great value for the money. We got great recommendations to restaurants and events from both Muhamet and Abel. Hi speed internet was good.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel in Great Location

reviews.text: Well located, very secure, good value, great ambience. Try and get one of the four rooms that look onto the courtyard.
reviews.title: Perfect location, will be back

reviews.text: Sergio & Abel are wonderful hosts, and I hope to be able to stay at their hotel again. The location is perfect for getting around the city, the rooms are comfortable, the breakfasts are lavish and well-presented. I would definitely recommend this small, boutique hotel to friends. If you rent patio rooms, breakfast is served on the patio, otherwise in rooms or in lounge.
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay and recommend it to others

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have traveled to many different countries and this quaint boutique hotel now ranks as one of our favourite places to stay. The location was excellent and our hotel stay gave us what we always hope for in a vacation -- a cultural experience, good memories and stories to share. A sincere passion and appreciation for the opulence and artistry of a forgotten past is poured into every detail of its beautifully restored antique rooms (as fellow renovators, we know how much time and effort went into this place!). This hotel has so much character and everywhere you look, there is another surprise. We felt like royalty every morning we awoke to the ornate chandelier and rich, red curtains in our room and this feeling continued right through our continental breakfast. Not only was it delicious and satisfying, but they staged it using their antique china and silverware so that we felt like we were transported back in time -- a true delight. They were also able to accommodate a gluten-free breakfast, which was truly appreciated, especially since we know this requires special arrangements. In addition, we felt Abel went out of his way for us during our stay in little ways which made the experience more personal and he was such a pleasure to deal with. We were also glad we purchased the additional transfer service he offered to the airport as it made our morning departure stress-free. We have already recommended this hotel to friends.
reviews.title: Quaint Boutique Hotel and Regal Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at the hostel in the dark of the evening but had no problem finding it. It is situated about 5 mins walk away from the Place de Catalunya, right in the heart of Barcelona, where the Aeroport bus (cheap and regular) can drop you off. Admittedly the entrance is via a darkened stairwell and their are no lift facilities but for us this was not a problem.
reviews.title: Not a chain - and all the better for it

reviews.text: Once in the hostel this is quickly forgotten anyway as the welcome from Felipe was warm and friendly and quickly we felt comfortable in our room (the suite) and the decor delightful.
reviews.title: Excellent in context of price and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was fantastic - the antiques give the place a lovely character and we were lucky enough to have a balcony veranda overlooking the street, which though busy, did not disturb our sleep in the slightest. (Though we did have the double sound insulation that the suites balcony provides).
reviews.title: an ok stay

reviews.text: We discovered this gem through Trip Advisor & everything about it was fantastic. Our stay of 9 days was great since the art nouveau buildings(which we loved so much) were so close. The location couldn't be better; the staff was very accommodating & pleasant; etc. We appreciated the owner who is passionate about collecting antiques for the rooms. He worked very hard to restore this wonderful boutique hotel. it was a very memorable stay.
reviews.title: loved our stay

reviews.text: A friend and I stayed for 3 wonderful nights. Abel and Sergio took fabulous care of us, including making a snack for my friend (who is recently pregnant) late one night when she was hungry and it was a bit late to get out for food. This is a wonderful renovation, and you can feel the love, care and effort that has gone into making this hostel and welcoming home after touring the city. We stayed in Room 101, with twin beds, and deemed the beds magic, we slept so well! Although the room is right on the busy street, the windows effectively block all noise. The shower is a bit tight, but great water pressure, and it does what it needs to do.
reviews.title: Can't Wait to go back!!

likes.liked: — Abel, Sergio and the great staff and beautiful decor

reviews.text: We wanted to return for the two nights we would be back in Barcelona before going home, alas, everything was booked up. No surprise there. I am looking forward to going back, both to Barcelona and to this very special hostel.
reviews.title: Wonderful

likes.disliked: — Having to be buzzed in every time you came home

reviews.text: What a great place. You are right in the middle of all the action. Arrival is easy, just ring the buzzer and go up the stairs. You are essentially living in an apartment building so you see the residents going in and out. The place has an interesting decor but is quite comfortable and everyone is friendly. I stayed in room 106 and loved having the patio to relax on and drink wine. The bathrooms are small but well maintained and adequate. I chose not to have breakfast there but found plenty of wonderful cafes within a 4 block walk. The help at the front desk provided me with great restaurant recommendations and really put you in the heart of this active city. I would definitely stay here again and recommend anyone else the same.
reviews.title: Great location, staff & CLEAN

reviews.text: We stayed two nights and were impressed with the cleanliness of the room and friendliness of the staff. We asked for recommendations for Tapas and Catalan restaurants and to avoid tourist traps and were directed to excellent places. The food was the best of our three week Mediterranean vacation! Excellent location near Las Ramblas and Placa Catalunya, where you can catch the sightseeing and airport buses. Will stay again and highly recommend this hostel to anyone who enjoys a European style hotel.
reviews.title: Cute two star hotel

reviews.text: I booked this on the strength of TripAdvisor reviews and I wasn't disappointed. You won't find it on expedia but try a site called easytobook dot com. It can be a little tricky to find first time but look for a red flag over the doorway. If you're coming by train, it's just two blocks from Passege de Gracia mainline station, so don't go all the way to the centre.
reviews.title: Like staying in a museum (in a good way!)

reviews.text: All the staff are terrific - really helpful and friendly. It's worth paying a little extra for one of the rooms that open out on to the patio: sure, it's tiny but it's great to get your breakfast out there for a treat. Remember to book your feast the night before and you won't be disappointed. Just don't plan to walk too fast for the next few hours......
reviews.title: Wonderful small hotel

reviews.text: The purpose of the stay was a leisurely weekend away with my mother. I thought she would enjoy the uniqueness of this hotel, quite different from the contemporary (and stale) hotels. I loved it from first sight, but my mother was not overly impressed with it - it seems she prefers the modern look However by the end of the stay, she came to love the quirkiness of it. Abel and Sergio, the owners, made our stay particularly enjoyable stay.
Pros
reviews.title: Funky in a good way

reviews.text: Abel and Sergio
reviews.title: The best place to end a Spyns Pamplona tour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast on the patio
reviews.title: Great Value in a Wonderful City

reviews.text: Exceedingly comfy beds
reviews.title: Old Time Appeal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed for 2 nights and were treated really special.beautiful furniture and decore. i am going again in march 2008. breakfast was served on beautiful china and oh what an amazing breakfast. we were so well taken care of and i loved every moment. this hotel and the staff are what made barcelona so special. definitely worth a visit!
reviews.title: small part of paradise

reviews.text: I booked this hotel online and whilst the website messed up the dates Sergio was fantastic at replying to my emails and straightening it all out.
reviews.title: Unique rooms and wonderfully friendly owners...

likes.liked: — The decor and the owners friendliness

aka: Hostal l` Antic Espai Hotel Barcelona
description: L´Antic Espai arises after a dream of creating in Barcelona a special space with an old world charm. we create an place in which always, we wished to enjoy a pleasant stay and where you feel like in your own house. Our services and personalized treatment will make you to remember and miss us for ever in all trips you plan.
